pages.title: Introduction
pages.subtitle: What Am I
pages.author: KesieV
article: The hardest past of the Programmino project has been finding a homogeneous definition of what it was.
By design, it's an attempt of implementing a machine I've seen in my dreams.
Technically, it's a configurable code interpreter tied up with some hardware simulations, like the screen, the memory, and so on.
Practically, it's a simple IDE with a magazine viewer.

But what's its purpose? The design choices allow you to code as you shouldn't on purpose. The technical compromises made it unable to run some programs. The practical minimalism made it a toy. So what do I expect you to use this thing?
After thinking about that for a while, I decided to give up. I'm leaving one of my dreams in this code. I'm leaving its broken stuff in this magazine.
A cryptic painting that's perhaps missing a piece.
